content.text:
The use of over one million small tiles to make the Alexander Mosaic allowed its creator to . <image 1>

A. depict a disorganized scene that overwhelms the viewer
B. model the anatomy of the figures naturalistically
C. modify and transport the composition easily
D. reduce the figures into abstract forms

The use of over one million small tiles in the Alexander Mosaic allowed its creator to:

B. model the anatomy of the figures naturalistically

The intricate details and the lifelike representation of the figures, horses, and their movements suggest that the mosaic was designed to capture the naturalistic anatomy and dynamics of the scene. The small tiles enabled the artist to create fine details and realistic textures, which would not have been possible with larger pieces or fewer tiles. This level of detail contributes to the overall realism and dynamism of the scene depicted in the mosaic.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
